pull.title: [tests] Speed up knapsack_solver_test by not recreating wallet 100 times.
pull.body:
Optimization of `knapsack_solver_test`by moving an expensive wallet creation to outside a 100x for loop.

On my (slow) machine:

```
before:        9.8s
after:         6.2s
--------------------
saved:         3.6s (36%)
```

This PR was split from #13050. Also see #10026.

events.body: I don't think this is entirely useful considering that this test will be removed (hopefully soon) altogether by #13307.

> I don't think this is entirely useful considering that this test will be removed (hopefully soon) altogether by #13307. 

On the other hand this change is pretty straightforward, and might make sense until #13307 is merged.
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->No more conflicts as of last run.

events.message:
Speed up knapsack_solver_test by not recreating wallet 100 times.

Moved the code for creating the wallet out of the 100-times repetition loop, for the most time-consuming tests.

events.body: It's months later and #13307 is still in state of flux. I'm going ahead and merging this.

:tada: Congratz on halving the total memory usage of `make check` as well:

https://bitcoinperf.com/timeline/?exe=3%2C4%2C2%2C1&base=1%2B23&ben=makecheck.clang.3.mem-usage&env=1&revs=10&equid=on&quarts=on&extr=on

![screenshot_2018-09-12 bitcoin core bench timeline](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6399679/45442407-f01fe200-b68f-11e8-8337-a8618572d841.png)
